intro: Hibiscus kahilii, commonly known as the Kauaʻi hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Hibiscus kahilii is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus species and cotton.
